siteProductLine.name: S637
siteProductLine.overview:
Sailun's S637 is a regional, all-position commercial tire that's designed to offer drivers exceptional stability.

Features & Benefits
  • Tread is designed for commercial use
  • Black sidewall
  • Tread design reduces rolling resistance to improve fuel efficiency
siteProductLine.secondaryDescription: An all-position, regional tire, the S637 from Sailun offers commercial drivers improved traction in wet conditions along with a prolonged tread life. Five extra-wide ribs increase stability at all speeds, and the S637's tread groove wall improves traction while also reducing irregular wear.

siteProductSpecs.name: Vehicle
siteProductSpecs.description: Designed for use on commercial truckers, trailers, vans, and other hauling vehicles. Commercial tires are often built for use in the drive, steer, axle, or all position in regional, line haul, urban, and pickup and delivery applications.

siteProductSpecs.name: Mileage Warranty
siteProductSpecs.description: This product is not covered by a manufacturer’s treadlife warranty.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Index
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum carrying capacity for a tire determined by the manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Max Speed
siteProductSpecs.description: Maximum speed capability to safely carry a load for an extended period of time.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum load carrying strength at the specified inflation pressure, also known as ply rating.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Depth
siteProductSpecs.description: Measured in 32nds of an inch, this metric shows how much tread life is left on a tire, with the tire's traction & stopping capabilities greatly diminished at 4/32nds and less. Tire manufacturers include "tire wear bars" at 2/32nds to indicate when your tire is worn out.

siteProductSpecs.name: Inflation Pressure
siteProductSpecs.description: The highest inflation pressure (measured in pounds of force per square inch, PSI) the tire is designed to contain, and should only be used when called for by the vehicle placard.

siteProductSpecs.name: Part Number
siteProductSpecs.description: An identifier of a particular tire line and size combination assigned by the tire manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Design
siteProductSpecs.description: Tread design (or tread pattern) can affect handling, traction & noise for different driving styles & road conditions.

siteProductSpecs.name: Section Width
siteProductSpecs.description: The measurement of width from a tires inner sidewall to the outer sidewall.

siteProductSpecs.name: Rim Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The range of widths the rim of the vehicle can be for this tire to be safely mounted on.

siteProductSpecs.name: Overall Diameter
siteProductSpecs.description: The diameter of a tire that is inflated without any load applied.

siteProductSpecs.name: Commercial Application
siteProductSpecs.description: Designed for short usage use in city and urban environments.

siteProductSpecs.name: Commercial Position
siteProductSpecs.description: Designed for the front axle but can perform on all axles.

siteDynamicModal.title: Oversized Tires.
siteDynamicModal.content: We offer fast shipping on every tire shipped to an installer partner or FedEx pickup location. A nominal shipping fee will be added for oversized tires (typically larger farm, commercial and industrial sizes). Learn more about your delivery options in our FAQ.

siteCatalogSummaryPrompt.title: Please search by vehicle to find the best tires
